primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in the human condition to transform the 'messed up' heart, moving the believer from ritual/moral self-justification to a relationship with the Living God.

tekstueel_bewijs: It can be changed only by the intervening presence of the living God
the Lord set his heart in love upon your fathers and chose their descendants
The biblical God speaks, and his Word has the power to bring into being that which it describes

object.identificatie: Transformation of the human heart / Knowledge of God
tekstueel_bewijs: The human heart needs to be changed from the bottom up

zender.identificatie: The Living God (as the source of Election and Word)
tekstueel_bewijs: Behold, to the Lord your God belong heaven... yet the Lord set his heart in love upon your fathers
You are God’s people whom he loves. You have been elected by him

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ / The Word / The Torah (properly understood)
tekstueel_bewijs: without the grace of God by Christ going before us
his Word has the power to bring into being
all members of the human race suffer... from an 'infection of nature'
Self-righteousness is always the greatest danger for religious people
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The preacher defines the problem as an ontological 'infection' that cannot be cured by natural strength, requiring a divine intervention.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer reflects God's glory and keeps the commandments as a response to election.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer (as the 'Chosen')
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is explicitly grounded in the primary program (election/grace).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Jesus/Word → Living God ← Infection of Nature/Self-Righteousness

voorbeelden_god_subject: God demonstrates his quite shocking indifference to religious propriety.
The Lord set his heart in love upon your fathers.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We all look askance at people.
Lieberman mentioned God in a speech.

voorbeelden: No Christian man whatsoever is free from the obedience of the Commandments.
Let us love the living God; let us praise the living God.
Do you know him as a living reality in your heart?
we cannot turn and prepare ourselves by our own natural strength
It can be changed only by the intervening presence of the living God

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon centers on the 'Pouvoir' (Power) of God vs the 'Non-Pouvoir' of man. It is a classic grace-oriented structure where the Subject's competence is entirely gifted.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from ~S2 (Ritual Purity) to ~S1 (Religion/Self-Improvement), exposes them as failing to address S2 (Infection), and finally resolves in S1 (Grace/Intervention).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God's 'shocking indifference' to religious propriety and His sovereign election.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; sin is described as an 'infection of nature' that humans cannot overcome.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the active Subject of salvation and heart-transformation, while relegating human effort to the realm of 'religion' which Jesus sweeps away.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: he gives every sign of being a man who knows the living God

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: It can be changed only by the intervening presence of the living God
we cannot turn and prepare ourselves by our own natural strength

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Joe Lieberman is used as a contemporary example of 'knowing the living God,' but the preacher pivots to show that such knowledge is a gift of God's nearness, not a human achievement.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this by emphasizing God's election of the fathers.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the burden of self-improvement; awe toward God.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'radical' Jesus to the 'near' God of Deuteronomy is handled by making God the Subject of both.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'Moral Law' requirement in the Articles of Religion and Jesus 'sweeping away' categories of righteousness.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: intervening presence of the living God... fellowship with the contaminated

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; described as an 'infection' and 'messed up' heart.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is structurally sound as a grace-oriented narrative. God is the Subject, the heart is the Object, and Sin is the Heavy Opponent.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain the current focus on Pouvoir (God's power).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Ensure the 'knowing' is always framed as a result of God's 'revealing'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of theocentric preaching that uses a contemporary political figure to illustrate a deep theological truth without falling into moralism.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the Lieberman hook; semiotics reveals that Lieberman is merely a 'helper' actant to point to the 'Subject' (God).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the mezuzah; semiotics explains why the mezuzah functions as a sign of the 'Sender's' values.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that despite the 'Moral High Ground' imagery, the sermon's engine is fueled by divine intervention, not human climbing.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully navigates the Law/Gospel distinction by identifying the Law as 'near' because of God's nearness, not human effort.
